com.lonepulse.robozombie.proxy
Class InvocationException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.lang.RuntimeException
              com.lonepulse.robozombie.RoboZombieRuntimeException
                  com.lonepulse.robozombie.proxy.InvocationException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class InvocationException
extends RoboZombieRuntimeException

This runtime exception is thrown when a proxy invocation was unsuccessful due to an error in any of the following aspects:

  1. Request Processing
  2. Request Execution
  3. Response Processing

Since:
1.3.0

Version:
1.1.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

newInstance

public static InvocationException newInstance(InvocationContext context,
                                              org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)

Creates a new instance of InvocationException with the HttpResponse (with the failed status code) and the InvocationContext which resulted in this response.

Parameters:
context - the InvocationContext which initiated the failed request

response - the HttpResponse which contains the failure status code

Since:
1.3.0

newInstance

public static InvocationException newInstance(InvocationContext context,
                                              org.apache.http.HttpResponse response,
                                              Throwable rootCause)

Creates a new instance of InvocationException with the HttpResponse (with the failed status code) and the InvocationContext which resulted in this response, while preserving the stacktrace. If the given root cause is already a InvocationException, it's returned as it is.

Parameters:
context - the InvocationContext which initiated the failed request

response - the HttpResponse which contains the failure status code

rootCause - the root Throwable which resulted in an execution failure

Since:
1.3.0

newInstance

public static InvocationException newInstance(InvocationContext context,
                                              Throwable rootCause)

Creates a new instance of InvocationException for a failed request execution with the InvocationContext which was used to construct the request. If the given root cause is already a InvocationException, it's returned as it is.

Parameters:
context - the InvocationContext which initiated the failed request

rootCause - the root Throwable which resulted in an execution failure

Since:
1.3.0

getResponse

public org.apache.http.HttpResponse getResponse()

Retrieves the HttpResponse which was returned for the request.

Note that if this instance of InvocationException signals an error which resulted before or during request execution, an HttpResponse will not be available. Use hasResponse() to determine if a response is available.

Returns:
the HttpResponse for the failed request, else null if this instance signals an error which occurred before or during request execution

Since:
1.3.0

hasResponse

public boolean hasResponse()

Determines if this instance represents a failure which resulted after request execution; in which case getResponse() will return the recieved HttpResponse.

Returns:
true if this instance represents a request failure and the received HttpResponse is available, else false if it represents an execution error and getResponse() returns null

Since:
1.3.0

getContext

public InvocationContext getContext()

Retrieves the InvocationContext which initiated the failed request.

Returns:
the InvocationContext for the failed request

Since:
1.3.0
